newsitem.title: CANADA: Zeneca gets Canadian approval for drug.
newsitem.headline: Zeneca gets Canadian approval for drug.

text.p: Zeneca Pharmaceuticals, a unit of Zeneca Group Plc, said it received approval from Canada's Health Protection Branch for its breast cancer drug Arimidex, which reduces treatment side effects for patients with advanced cases.

Spokeswoman Vanessa Eaton said the drug had a potential market of 20,000 patients in Canada. If half decided to use the drug, Zeneca had potential sales of C$1 million, Eaton said. Arimidex reduces side effects such as weight gain, which helps enhance a person's self-esteem, Eaton said. About one in nine Canadian women will develop breast cancer.
